data.text:
I have such a clear memory of that first evening at Montagu House, of all the family sitting on suitcases and packing cases in the entrance hall, with an improvised supper of sandwiches and cool drinks. The front door was open and there was a glorious view and smell of the sea, beautiful sensations and evening light.

My mother said she thought this move was good fortune, because Montagu was the name of the small country town where she was born and brought up. It was 1959, and I was 10 when we moved to the house on Alexander Road, in the suburb of Sea Point, Cape Town. It was a beautiful house with terracotta tiles and a porch that ran along the front â€”
